module.translation[0].definitions[0].def: one of the separate units that a course of study has been divided into. Usually students choose a number of modules to study
module.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: You choose five modules in the first year.
module.translation[0].definitions[1].def: one of several parts of a piece of computer software that does a particular job
module.translation[0].definitions[2].def: a part of a spacecraft that can be separated from the main part and used for a particular purpose
module.translation[0].definitions[3].def: one of several separate parts that can be combined to form a larger object, such as a machine or building
module.translation[1].definitions[0].def: one of several separate parts that can be combined to form a larger thing
module.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: Software is often written in modules by teams of programmers.
module.translation[1].definitions[1].def: one of the units that a course of study has been divided into, each of which can be studied separately
